intro: Neoachmandra cunninghamii, commonly known as the Cunningham's neoachmandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in heathland and open forest areas, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
